I then received a £100 parking charge notice (PCN) from the car park operator, Ocean Parking. It said no parking is allowed on the site between 9pm and 6am.

c899c4562df9.title: These cuts to physics research will be a disaster for UK scientists – and for our standing in the world | Jon Butterworth
c899c4562df9.summary: Сокращение финансирования физических исследований в Великобритании, по мнению физика Джона Баттерворта, станет серьезным ударом для британской науки.  Планируемые урезать средства могут лишить ученых возможности участвовать в крупных международных проектах, таких как CERN, что грозит закрытием отделов физики и оттоком специалистов из страны.

1acb3b507198.title: Why is monogamy in crisis? The animal kingdom could give us some clues | Elle Hunt
1acb3b507198.summary: Статья в Elle Hunt рассматривает кризис моногамии у людей, отмечая снижение числа пар и браков. Автор предполагает, что изменяющиеся у нас брачные модели могут приближаться к естественному порядку, наблюдаемому в животном мире, где моногамия не является универсальной нормой.

We don’t have a single verb to express smelling something nice. Welsh and Croatian, by contrast, are never caught short when something fragrant gets right up your nose

aa783b42f169.title: Should we really all be taking magnesium supplements? – podcast
aa783b42f169.summary:
Testimonials about the beneficial health effects of magnesium supplements abound online, with influencers claiming that a daily pill can help with everything from anxiety to sleep and brain fog. But do any of these claims stack up?

54f79f646f55.title: What bots talk about when they think humans aren’t listening – podcast
54f79f646f55.summary:
In late January a new social media site took a certain corner of the internet by storm. Moltbook was conceived as a space where AI assistants could let off steam, chat and compare notes on their bosses, but it quickly became the focus of breathless claims that the singularity had arrived as the bots started badmouthing their humans and plotting an uprising. So what’s the truth about Moltbook? Madeleine Finlay hears from Aisha Down about what it tells us about AI, and about us.

Ранее он называл лунные проекты отвлекающим фактором, но теперь компания планирует активную деятельность на Луне. Возникают вопросы о возможных влияниях на такое решение, в частности, со стороны администрации Трампа.

Moon was a distraction and Mars the goal for billionaire SpaceX chief – could Trump have influenced his U-turn?

1b11da2ed6db.title: Are we hard-wired for infidelity?
1b11da2ed6db.summary:
Monogamy may be held up as an ideal, but evolution has other ideas

Most of us know people in committed relationships, even lifelong marriages. And we also know stories about relationship transgressions, of partnerships tested or broken by infidelity.

As an evolutionary biologist who studies sex and relationships, I’m fascinated by these two truths. We humans make romantic commitments to each other – and some also break those commitments by cheating.

a0c7d7600a28.title: New map reveals where lethal scorpions are most likely to strike
a0c7d7600a28.summary: Scientists have developed a powerful new way to forecast where some of the world’s most dangerous scorpions are likely to be found. By combining fieldwork in Africa with advanced computer modeling, the team discovered that soil type is the strongest factor shaping where many lethal species live, while temperature patterns also play a key role.

8c7d50cc7899.title: Sugary drinks linked to rising anxiety in teens
8c7d50cc7899.summary: Sugary drinks may be linked to more than just physical health problems in teens. A new review of multiple studies found a consistent association between high consumption of beverages like soda, energy drinks, sweetened juices, and flavored milks and increased anxiety symptoms in adolescents.

62778a348752.title: Intermittent fasting fails to beat standard dieting for weight loss
62778a348752.summary: Intermittent fasting has become one of the most talked-about weight loss trends in recent years, promising dramatic results with simple changes to when you eat. But a major Cochrane review suggests the reality may be far less exciting. After analyzing 22 clinical trials involving nearly 2,000 adults, researchers found that intermittent fasting did not produce significantly more weight loss than standard diet advice or even no structured plan at all.

5e2def1c45e8.title: AI breakthrough could replace rare earth magnets in electric vehicles
5e2def1c45e8.summary: Ученые из Университета Нью-Гэмпшира разработали искусственный интеллект для ускоренного поиска новых магнитных материалов. Благодаря созданию обширной базы данных, включающей 67 573 соединений, включая 25 новых высокотемпературных магнитов, технология может заменить редкие земные магниты в электромобилях, делая их более доступными и экологичными.
5e2def1c45e8.original_description: Scientists at the University of New Hampshire have unleashed artificial intelligence to dramatically speed up the hunt for next-generation magnetic materials. By building a massive, searchable database of 67,573 magnetic compounds — including 25 newly recognized materials that stay magnetic even at high temperatures — the team is opening the door to cheaper, more sustainable technologies.

f79e52468cbd.title: Ancient microbes may have used oxygen 500 million years before it filled Earth’s atmosphere
f79e52468cbd.summary: Life on Earth may have learned to breathe oxygen long before oxygen filled the skies. MIT researchers traced a key oxygen-processing enzyme back hundreds of millions of years before the Great Oxidation Event. Early microbes living near oxygen-producing cyanobacteria may have quickly used up the gas as it formed, slowing its rise in the atmosphere. The results suggest life was adapting to oxygen far earlier — and far more creatively — than once thought.

59c1efca1e44.title: New sodium ion battery stores twice the energy and desalinates seawater
59c1efca1e44.summary: Ученые разработали новый тип аккумулятора на натриевых ионах, который обладает высокой емкостью и скоростью зарядки, а также стабильностью в работе.  Инновация заключается в удержании воды внутри ключевого материала батареи, что значительно повышает ее производительность.  Эта разработка может сделать натриевые аккумуляторы конкурентоспособными с литий-ионными и открыть возможности для опреснения морской воды.
59c1efca1e44.original_description: A surprising breakthrough could help sodium-ion batteries rival lithium—and even turn seawater into drinking water. Scientists discovered that keeping water inside a key battery material, instead of removing it as traditionally done, dramatically boosts performance. The “wet” version stores nearly twice as much charge, charges faster, and remains stable for hundreds of cycles, placing it among the top-performing sodium battery materials ever reported.

de75fbdac219.title: Ancient drought may have wiped out the real-life hobbits 61,000 years ago
de75fbdac219.summary: A massive, centuries-long drought may have driven the extinction of the “hobbits” of Flores. Climate records preserved in cave formations show rainfall plummeted just as the small human species disappeared. At the same time, pygmy elephants they depended on declined sharply as rivers dried up. With food and water vanishing, the hobbits may have been pushed out—and into their final chapter.

8f09064d7a07.title: A spinning gyroscope could finally unlock ocean wave energy
8f09064d7a07.summary: Ocean waves are a vast and steady source of renewable energy, but capturing their power efficiently has long frustrated engineers. A researcher at The University of Osaka has now explored a bold new approach: a gyroscopic wave energy converter that uses a spinning flywheel inside a floating structure to turn wave motion into electricity. By harnessing gyroscopic precession—the subtle wobble of a spinning object under force—the system can be tuned to absorb energy across a wide range of wave cond

48ea69d08a3e.title: The Moon is still shrinking and it could trigger more moonquakes
48ea69d08a3e.summary: Researchers have uncovered more than a thousand previously unknown tectonic ridges across the Moon’s dark plains, showing the Moon is still contracting and reshaping itself. These features are among the youngest geological structures on the lunar surface. Because they form through the same forces linked to past moonquakes, they could signal new seismic hotspots.

67f5a8f5c718.title: People who switched to cannabis drinks cut their alcohol use nearly in half
67f5a8f5c718.summary: A new University at Buffalo study suggests cannabis-infused beverages could help some people cut back on alcohol. In a survey of cannabis users, those who drank cannabis beverages reported cutting their weekly alcohol intake roughly in half and binge drinking less often. Nearly two-thirds said they reduced or stopped drinking alcohol after starting cannabis drinks.

c25330a43d78.title: A satellite illusion hid the true scale of Arctic snow loss
c25330a43d78.summary: For years, satellite data suggested that autumn snow cover in the Northern Hemisphere was actually increasing — a surprising twist in a warming world. But a new analysis reveals that this apparent growth was an illusion caused by improving satellite technology that became better at detecting thin snow over time. In reality, snow cover has been shrinking by about half a million square kilometers per decade.

ddfc604c8a92.title: Viagra and shingles vaccine show surprising promise against Alzheimer’s
ddfc604c8a92.summary: Новое исследование выявило потенциал трех известных лекарств – препарата от эректильной дисфункции Виагры (силденафила), вакцины от опоясывающего лишая и рилузола – в борьбе с болезнью Альцгеймера. Вакцина от опоясывающего лишая (Zostavax) показала наибольшую перспективность среди проанализированных 80 препаратов для возможного повторного применения в лечении нейродегенеративного заболевания.
ddfc604c8a92.original_description: A major new study has spotlighted three familiar medicines that could take on an unexpected new role in the fight against Alzheimer’s disease — with a shingles vaccine emerging as the front-runner. After reviewing 80 existing drugs, an international panel of experts identified Zostavax, Viagra (sildenafil), and riluzole as the most promising candidates for repurposing.

30c240e673da.title: Toxic metals found in bananas after Brazil mining disaster
30c240e673da.summary: Исследование показало, что после крупного горнодобывающего происшествия в Бразилии токсичные металлы, такие как свинец и кадмий, попадают в пищевые культуры. В частности, бананы, маниока и какао показали повышенное содержание этих элементов, что представляет потенциальную опасность для детей до шести лет, а также вызывает опасения относительно долгосрочного воздействия на здоровье взрослых.
30c240e673da.original_description: Researchers investigating crops grown in soil contaminated by the 2015 mining disaster in Brazil discovered that toxic metals are moving from the earth into edible plants. Bananas, cassava, and cocoa were found to absorb elements like lead and cadmium, with bananas showing a potential health risk for children under six. Although adults face lower immediate danger, scientists warn that long-term exposure could carry cumulative health consequences.

a0f16d7048aa.title: Ancient DNA solves 12,000-year-old mystery of rare genetic growth disorder
a0f16d7048aa.summary: An Ice Age double burial in Italy has yielded a stunning genetic revelation. DNA from a mother and daughter who lived over 12,000 years ago shows that the younger had a rare inherited growth disorder, confirmed through mutations in a key bone-growth gene. Her mother carried a milder version of the same mutation. The finding not only solves a long-standing mystery but also proves that rare genetic diseases stretch far back into prehistory.

4da5e459c543.title: Ultra-fast pulsar found near the Milky Way’s supermassive black hole
4da5e459c543.summary: Scientists scanning the heart of the Milky Way have spotted a tantalizing signal: a possible ultra-fast pulsar spinning every 8.19 milliseconds near Sagittarius A*, the supermassive black hole at our galaxy’s core. Pulsars act like incredibly precise cosmic clocks, and finding one in this extreme environment could open a rare window into how space-time behaves under intense gravity.

21c0f6ef62d6.title: NASA fired three rockets into the northern lights and the results are stunning
21c0f6ef62d6.summary: NASA has pulled off a high-flying aurora investigation, launching three rockets into the glowing northern lights over Alaska. One mission targeted mysterious dark patches called black auroras, while the twin GNEISS rockets created a 3D scan of the aurora’s electrical currents. All rockets reached their planned altitudes and returned strong data. The result: an unprecedented look at how these dazzling light shows are wired from space to sky.

465673474beb.title: 125 million-year-old dinosaur with never before seen hollow spikes discovered in China
465673474beb.summary: A 125-million-year-old dinosaur just rewrote what we thought we knew about prehistoric life. Scientists in China have uncovered an exceptionally preserved juvenile iguanodontian with fossilized skin so detailed that individual cells are still visible. Even more astonishing, the plant-eating dinosaur was covered in hollow, porcupine-like spikes—structures never before documented in any dinosaur.

6c1ed526edaf.title: Breakthrough CRISPR system could reverse antibiotic resistance crisis
6c1ed526edaf.summary: Ученые из UC San Diego разработали новый CRISPR-инструмент, способный обратить вспять устойчивость бактерий к антибиотикам. Технология распространяет генетическую "исправку" в бактериальных популяциях, включая устойчивые к антибиотикам биопленки, что может стать прорывом в борьбе с надвигающейся глобальной угрозой антибиотикорезистентности.
6c1ed526edaf.original_description: Antibiotic resistance is racing toward a global crisis, with “superbugs” projected to cause over 10 million deaths annually by 2050. Now, scientists at UC San Diego have unveiled a powerful new CRISPR-based tool that doesn’t just fight resistant bacteria—it can actively strip away their drug resistance. Inspired by gene drives used in insects, the technology spreads a genetic “fix” through bacterial populations, even inside stubborn biofilms that shield microbes from antibiotics.

d9ef65545c5e.title: Climate change is accelerating but nature is slowing down
d9ef65545c5e.summary: As the planet warms, many expected ecosystems to change faster and faster. Instead, a massive global study shows that species turnover has slowed by about one-third since the 1970s. Nature’s constant reshuffling appears to be driven more by internal ecological dynamics than by climate alone. The slowdown may signal something alarming: ecosystems losing the biodiversity needed to keep their engines running.

d06ce72150bd.title: Mysterious RNA led scientists to a hidden layer of cancer
d06ce72150bd.summary: A mysterious RNA found in breast cancer led scientists to uncover an entire hidden class of cancer-specific RNAs across dozens of tumor types. These molecules form unique molecular signatures that identify cancer type and subtype with remarkable accuracy. Some even drive tumor growth and metastasis. Because many are released into the bloodstream, a simple blood test can track how patients respond to treatment and predict survival.
